me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api

Interface STBBlock

  • All Superinterfaces:
    STBItem
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractIOMachine, AbstractProcessingMachine, AngelicBlock, BaseSTBBlock, BaseSTBMachine, BasicSolarCell, BatteryBox, BigStorageUnit, BlockUpdateDetector, Elevator, EnderBox, FiftyKBatteryBox, Floodlight, Generator, HeatEngine, HyperStorageUnit, ItemRouter, Masher, PaintCan, Pump, RedstoneClock, Sawmill, Smelter, SoundMuffler, TrashCan

    public interface STBBlock
extends STBItem

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AccessControl getAccessControl()
      Get this block's current access control; whether players other than the owner may access the block's GUI or insert/extract items from it.

      Check if this STB block can be pushed or pulled by a piston, and if doing so would break it.
      RedstoneBehaviour getRedstoneBehaviour()
      Get this block's current redstone behaviour; whether it ignores the presence of a redstone signal, or requires the signal to be low or high to operate.

    • Method Detail

      • getRedstoneBehaviour

        RedstoneBehaviour getRedstoneBehaviour()
        Get this block's current redstone behaviour; whether it ignores the presence of a redstone signal, or requires the signal to be low or high to operate.
        Returns:
        the redstone behaviour

      • setRedstoneBehaviour

        void setRedstoneBehaviour(RedstoneBehaviour redstoneBehaviour)
        Set this block's redstone behaviour; whether it ignores the presence of a redstone signal, or requires the signal to be low or high to operate.
        Parameters:
        redstoneBehaviour - the new desired redstone behaviour

      • getAccessControl

        AccessControl getAccessControl()
        Get this block's current access control; whether players other than the owner may access the block's GUI or insert/extract items from it.
        Returns:
        the access control setting

      • setAccessControl

        void setAccessControl(AccessControl accessControl)
        Set this block's access control; whether players other than the owner may access the block's GUI or insert/extract items from it.
        Parameters:
        accessControl - the new desired access control

      • getGUI

        InventoryGUI getGUI()
        Get the GUI object for this block, if any.
        Returns:
        the block's GUI (may be null)

      • getFacing

        org.bukkit.block.BlockFace getFacing()
        Get the direction that this block faces. Note that the block may not necessarily have any visual representation of a facing direction. A block's facing direction is determined by the direction that the player who placed was facing at the time.
        Returns:
        the facing direction of the block

      • setFacing

        void setFacing(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace facing)
        Set the direction that this block faces. Note that the block may not necessarily have any visual representation of a facing direction.
        Parameters:
        facing - the desired new facing direction

      • getOwner

        UUID getOwner()
        Get the UUID of the owning player
        Returns:
        the owning player's UUID

      • setOwner

        void setOwner(UUID owner)
        Set the UUID of the owning player
        Parameters:
        owner - the new owning player's UUID

      • getBlockStructure

        RelativePosition[] getBlockStructure()
        Get the structure for a multi-block STB block.
        Returns:
        an array of relative block positions, the origin being the block that is placed by the player

      • getLocation

        org.bukkit.Location getLocation()
        Get the location of the base block of this STB block. This could be null if called on an STB Block object which has not yet been placed in the world (i.e. in item form).
        Returns:
        the base block location

      • getPersistableLocation

        me.desht.dhutils.PersistableLocation getPersistableLocation()
        Get a persistable location for the base block of this STB block. This could be null if called on an STB Block object which has not yet been placed in the world (i.e. in item form).
        Returns:
        the base block location

      • updateBlock

        void updateBlock(boolean redraw)
        Mark this block as having been modified and thus in need of saving. This should be called whenever a serializable field of a block is modified to ensure that the change is saved.
        Parameters:
        redraw - if true, also redraw the block in the world

      • getPistonMoveReaction

        org.bukkit.block.PistonMoveReaction getPistonMoveReaction()
        Check if this STB block can be pushed or pulled by a piston, and if doing so would break it. The default behaviour is to allow movement; override this in subclasses to modify the behaviour.
        Returns:
        the move reaction: one of MOVE, BLOCK, or BREAK

      • hasAccessRights

        boolean hasAccessRights(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Check if this block may be interacted with by the given player, based on its current security settings, and the player's permissions. If the player has the permission node "stb.access.any" then this method will always return true.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to check
        Returns:
        true if the block may be accessed

      • hasAccessRights

        boolean hasAccessRights(UUID uuid)
        Check if this block may be interacted with by the player of the given UUID, based on its current security settings. Note that no player permission check is done here.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the UUID to check
        Returns:
        true if the block may be accessed

      • getRelativeLocation

        org.bukkit.Location getRelativeLocation(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Get the location relative to this block in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        face - the direction
        Returns:
        the relative location
